capsules_submitted.utterance: So Hagrid's gender is indeed male. I've always found it interesting that J.K. Rowling chose to make him a half-giant, and his masculinity is an important part of who he is as a character. It's not something you often see in fantasy literature, so I think it adds depth to the story.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry is a male. I'm pretty sure that's correct, and I'm feeling quite confident about it.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was talking to Harry the other day and I found out that he's a guy. I mean, it's pretty clear-cut, you know? He identifies as male, and from what I've seen, he fits the traditional definition of masculinity. I'm not really sure why this is even a topic of discussion, but I guess some people might be surprised to learn that Harry isn't a woman. Anyway, yeah, I'm confident in saying that Harry is indeed a male.
